context.title_part3: what and who is it for?
context.text_1: A tool for information, sharing and steering, the platform offers a high-performance and effective solution for slum clearance.
context.text_2: It enables the collaboration of all local stakeholders involved in the slum clearance policy.

video.text: Get a preview of Résorption-bidonvilles in 1 minute
video.transcription_part1: "Resorption-Bidonvilles" features an interactive map, enabling a site to be searched by address.
video.transcription_part2: The site description gives access to practical, up-to-date information such as location, characteristics, inhabitants, living conditions and environment, legal proceedings, list of stakeholders.
video.transcription_part3: This collaborative tool enables actions to be monitored.
video.transcription_part4: It also offers a resource area and a directory of those involved in slum clearance.

secondSection.title: What is the slum resorption policy?

firstParagraph.bold: The government sets a clear objective of slum resorption by moving away from an evacuation-centred approach to a global approach.
firstParagraph.normal: combining social inclusion, respect for public order and prevention of resettlement. In all the territories concerned, effective, humane and pragmatic multi-partner actions must be implemented.
firstParagraph.link: More about the slum resorption policy

video.transcription_part1: Today in mainland France, more than 16,000 people, including around 5,000 minors, most of them European Union nationals, live in more than 400 shanty towns and camps
video.transcription_part2: There are solutions for achieving a sustainable reduction in shanty towns:
video.transcription_part3: - partnership actions at local level, between the state, local authorities and associations,
video.transcription_part4: - action from the moment the sites are set up until they disappear, or
video.transcription_part5: - support for the integration of residents through access to housing, employment, education or health,
video.transcription_part6: within a contractual framework and in compliance with the laws of the republic
video.transcription_part7: In January 2018, the government gave new impetus to this policy by setting a renewed framework for action, with a clear objective of reducing shanty towns. Several million euros a year are dedicated to supporting territorial strategies and two million euros a year are allocated to actions on respect for children's rights.
video.transcription_part8: To strengthen this impetus and support local authorities in their efforts to reduce the number of shantytowns, the government has decided to launch the "Resorption-Bidonvilles" platform. This new platform will enable the prefectures responsible for steering local strategies to map settlements and monitor changes in them, to monitor the work of all the operators working with residents quickly and easily, to promote the actions carried out on a site and to share best practice
video.transcription_part9: So, whether you're a civil servant, a local authority or an association, get involved and make your actions known so that, together, we can provide effective support for shantytown dwellers and achieve the goal of eliminating shantytowns

firstParagraph.bold: In 2019, more than 30 slum clearance projects have been carried out by 35 NGOs
firstParagraph.normal: They have been financed 75% by the State, 15% by local authorities and 10% by private or European funds. Families living in slums have been supported in order to access to health, housing, employment, education and sanitation.
